class.name: PlannerMultigoal
class.brief_description: A [PlannerMultigoal] represents multiple goals to be achieved in a [PlannerPlan] and [PlannerDomain].
class.description: The [PlannerMultigoal] represents a set of goals that a [PlannerPlan] needs to be achieved and provides methods for managing the state variables associated with these goals.

method.name: get_goal_conditions_for_variable
method.description: Returns a [Dictionary] of all goal conditions (arguments and their desired values) for the specified variable name within this multigoal.

method.name: get_goal_value
method.description: Returns the desired value for a specific argument of a given variable in this multigoal. Returns null if the variable or argument is not found.

method.name: get_goal_variables
method.description: Returns an [Array] of all state variable names that are part of this multigoal.

method.name: has_goal_condition
method.description: Returns true if this multigoal has a specific goal condition defined for the given variable and argument, false otherwise.

method.name: method_goals_not_achieved
method.description: Compares the current state with the desired states in the multigoal and returns a [Dictionary] containing only the conditions from the multigoal that are not yet met in the current state.

method.name: method_split_multigoal
method.description: Splits a [PlannerMultigoal] into a list of individual unigoal tasks. It first identifies goals not yet achieved and then adds all goals from the current state, ensuring no duplicates based on variable and argument. If the resulting list is not empty, the original multigoal is added to the end of the list.

method.name: method_verify_multigoal
method.description: Verifies if all conditions in the multigoal are met by the current state. Returns an empty [Array] if all goals are achieved, or false if any goal is not achieved or if the multigoal is null. This is typically used for debugging and plan verification, potentially logging information if verbose is high enough.
